messages.title: LABOUR COMMITMENT CONSERVATIVE CHAOS
messages.content: We know that many of you like the Ian Goodchild Centre in Camberley and have also told us that you like the Youth Centre. We believe that the Conservative Council have been trying to move about the organisation of elderly persons’ housing away from Beggarstaff... A consultation is taking place with you as your views are important to us.

messages.title: HEARING YOUR VIEWS
messages.content: We promised that when elected, we would hold open public meetings twice a year so that you can ask us about any Old Dean or Camberley issue and what we are doing about them. Our SIXTH meeting will be taking place on: Monday 29th March - 7pm start at Old Dean Advice Centre

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Prevent raising the Council Tax this year by 2.5%. Opposed an increase by 22 votes to 9 as part of the Conservatives desire to invest in unnecessary Council corporate publicity.
Proposed a Surrey Heath Youth Council for young people to put forward their concerns about their area and this is successfully happening.

mentions.candidate: We are delighted to welcome Matt Willey as Labour’s Prospective Parliamentary Candidate in the forthcoming general election.

housing.content: The organisation of elderly persons’ housing away from Beggarstaff is being considered by the Conservative Council

leaflet.additionalNotes: Please contact Rodney on 01276 679595 to pick up your jumble.
